meanings.definition: relating to or resembling a cloaca
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the cloacal anatomy of birds.
meanings.sent2: The cloacal opening in reptiles serves multiple functions.
meanings.sent3: The cloacal design of the new building was both efficient and unique.
meanings.sent4: Her cloacal instincts guided her to the safest path.
meanings.sent5: The cloacal coloration of the lizard helped it blend into its surroundings.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the cloaca in birds and reptiles
meanings.sent1: The vet examined the bird's cloacal health.
meanings.sent2: Reptiles have a cloacal chamber for waste elimination.
meanings.sent3: The cloacal odor of the zoo's aviary was surprisingly pleasant.
meanings.sent4: His cloacal knowledge of bird anatomy was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The cloacal structure of the reptile was well-adapted to its environment.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the common cavity into which the intestinal, urinary, and genital canals open in birds, reptiles, and some fishes
meanings.sent1: The cloacal opening in the bird allows for efficient waste removal.
meanings.sent2: Some fishes have a cloacal passage for reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The cloacal system in reptiles is a marvel of nature.
meanings.sent4: Her cloacal understanding of avian biology was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The cloacal structure of the fish ensured reproductive success.
